title: Debtor did a fraudulent conveyance with zero value 2 weeks before he filed chapter 7. HOW DO I GET STANDING?
question: I am the only judgment creditor. Trustee did not want to pursue with debtor's fraudulent conveyance.
answers: If the Trustee passed on proceeding with a fraudulent conveyance action you may still be able to proceed with such an action yourself. You should meet with an experienced bankruptcy attorney that handles creditor rights/issues to see if you still have options available to you. There are time limits on bringing such actions so do not delay in seeking assistance.

You should check with a creditor’s rights attorney to see if this is worth pursuing. Generally, any recovery for a fraudulent conveyance is disbursed by the Trustee to all creditors. If the Trustee passed on it, there may not be much meat on the bone.
